jobs.title: Lead Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 Our Mission

At Pulley, we are on a mission to help construction teams break ground faster. The United States is short between 4-7 million homes while housing production and affordability remain near historic lows. Meanwhile, retail and office real estate are still adapting to the post-pandemic world and the AI boom has led to significant investments in data center infrastructure.

Permitting requirements vary vastly by jurisdiction, making it challenging to navigate for home builders, retailers, architects and contractors. It creates a critical bottleneck that every project must traverse. While the industry remains largely fragmented and underserved, we believe that combining cutting-edge software with permitting expertise can condense permitting timelines from months to days or even hours!

🏗️ About Us

We are a passionate team building software for the built environment around us. Founded by Charlie Jacobson and Andreas Rotenberg in 2021, our team combines deep experience in real estate and construction with a track record of shipping software loved by millions of customers.

We’re backed by CRV, Susa Ventures, BoxGroup, Fifth Wall, Operator, South Park Commons, Suffolk Construction and leaders from Plaid, Segment, Procore, ServiceTitan, Built, BuildZoom, and eero.

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

This role is based in our San Francisco, CA office, reporting to our CEO, Charlie Jacobson, and collaborating with our collocated design and engineering team of 10+ people.

Who you are

  • You're a product designer who cares deeply about designing the right thing before designing the thing right

  • Driven by curiosity, you find yourself obsessing over problems that "feel weird, but I don't know why yet"

  • Craft matters to you, the job isn’t done until it meets your bar

  • There is a method to your madness — you use principles and frameworks to solve problems of varying scale, knowing there's no single right approach (but there are wrong ones)

  • Excited about designing for work – at this point everyone uses software to do their jobs, you’re energized by making complex domains simple to work in

  • You are energized by working for startups. Translation: fast paced, async collaboration via Slack, can create something from nothing, act as an owner, and hold strong opinions loosely

What you'll do

  • Design and effectively communicate compelling user flows and specifications for stakeholders and engineers

  • Lead projects from concept to a successful launch, ensuring a high bar of execution

  • Interface directly with customers to collect feedback on new and existing functionality

  • Advocate for the user by partnering with product and engineering on product definition and roadmap

  • Explore leveraging AI to synthesize the complex and diverse world of permitting requirements at scale

  • Contribute to the design system and product design lifecycle at Pulley

Qualifications

  • 6+ years experience designing enterprise or B2B products or services

  • Expert with Figma designs and prototypes

  • Portfolio demonstrates strong interaction design thinking for complex workflows

  • Experience defining product requirements, translating user problems into clear solutions

  • Comfortable moderating evaluative and generative user interviews with external customers

  • Successfully shipped web based products and features collaborating closely with engineering

 - Expert with Figma designs and prototypes

jobs.title: Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 Our Mission

At Pulley, we are on a mission to help construction teams break ground faster. The United States is short between 4-7 million homes while housing production and affordability remain near historic lows. Meanwhile, retail and office real estate are still adapting to the post-pandemic world and the AI boom has led to significant investments in data center infrastructure.

Permitting requirements vary vastly by jurisdiction, making it challenging to navigate for home builders, retailers, architects and contractors. It creates a critical bottleneck that every project must traverse. While the industry remains largely fragmented and underserved, we believe that combining cutting-edge software with permitting expertise can condense permitting timelines from months to days or even hours!

🏗️ About Us

We are a passionate team building software for the built environment around us. Founded by Charlie Jacobson and Andreas Rotenberg in 2021, our team combines deep experience in real estate and construction with a track record of shipping software loved by millions of customers.

We’re backed by CRV, Susa Ventures, BoxGroup, Fifth Wall, Operator, South Park Commons, Suffolk Construction and leaders from Plaid, Segment, Procore, ServiceTitan, Built, BuildZoom, and eero.

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

🧑‍💻 The Role

In this role you will

  • Own the Full Sales Cycle: Take qualified opportunities from SDRs and your own outreach and lead them through discovery, solutioning, negotiation, and close with a focus on delivering value at every stage.

  • Drive New Business and Expand Existing Accounts: Convert qualified leads into customers, then grow those accounts by identifying upsell opportunities, new use cases, and wider adoption.

  • Execute Strategic Outreach: Collaborate with SDRs on targeted outreach strategies, account prioritization, and follow-up to ensure a steady flow of high-quality pipeline.

  • Communicate Value to Senior Stakeholders: Deliver clear, tailored pitches decision-makers, aligning product capabilities with business needs.

  • Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Partner with permitting, marketing and product teams to shape demos, proposals, and customer experiences that drive results.

  • Continuously Improve: Share insights from the field to help refine messaging, evolve the product, and strengthen sales processes.

  • Hit Your Number: Consistently meet or exceed your revenue targets while maintaining strong forecast accuracy and a focus on long-term customer success.

📋 Need to have

  • Consistent top performer in previous organizations

  • 4+ years of AE Experience

  • Experience with some sales methodology (MEDDPICC, BANT, Sandler, etc)

  • Team player mentality, adept at working cross-functionally and within sales org

  • Clear-eyed regarding the hustle, attitude, intellectual curiosity and flexibility needed to thrive in an early stage environment

  • Great communicator with exceptional writing, presentation, and interpersonal skills, paired with strong organization and time management to effectively manage priorities and build trust across stakeholders.

🌟 Nice to haves

  • Has worked into construction or construction-adjacent industry

  • Early stage startup experience

  • Eager to work hybrid in Manhattan

jobs.title: Senior Applied AI Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 Our Mission

At Pulley, we are on a mission to help construction teams break ground faster. The United States is short between 4-7 million homes while housing production and affordability remain near historic lows. Meanwhile, retail and office real estate are still adapting to the post-pandemic world and the AI boom has led to significant investments in data center infrastructure.

Permitting requirements vary vastly by jurisdiction, making it challenging to navigate for home builders, retailers, architects and contractors. It creates a critical bottleneck that every project must traverse. While the industry remains largely fragmented and underserved, we believe that combining cutting-edge software with permitting expertise can condense permitting timelines from months to days or even hours!

🏗️ About Us

We are a passionate team building software for the built environment around us. Founded by Charlie Jacobson and Andreas Rotenberg in 2021, our team combines deep experience in real estate and construction with a track record of shipping software loved by millions of customers.

We’re backed by CRV, Susa Ventures, BoxGroup, Fifth Wall, Operator, South Park Commons, Suffolk Construction and leaders from Plaid, Segment, Procore, ServiceTitan, Built, BuildZoom, and eero.

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

🧑‍💻 The Role

We are hiring an experienced AI engineer to join the Pulley team and help us accelerate and differentiate our product offering. As an early AI engineer at Pulley, you will get to:

  • Help construction teams break ground faster

  • Develop and deploy AI-driven features dealing with unstructured permitting documents, city regulations, etc

  • Shape the AI strategy and help build the foundation for AI/ML at Pulley

  • Contribute to system architecture, ensuring AI models are integrated seamlessly into our tech stack (React, Tailwind, TypeScript, Vercel, and Google Cloud)

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with product, design, and engineering teams to deliver AI-enhanced experiences that feel intuitive and reliable

We are looking for someone who:

  • Has 5+ years of ML/AI experience at a technology company

  • Has experience working with large language models, fine tuning and retrieval-augmented generation

  • Is familiar with and comfortable setting up AI and data infra from scratch such as vector databases, LangChain and TensorFlow

  • Is based in the San Francisco Bay Area, willing to work in-person 4 days a week.

  • Thrives in ambiguity and defines the right problems to solve

  • Can translate complex customer needs into extensible, scalable product solutions

  • Enjoys collaborating with engineers and designers to meticulously craft great experiences

  • Architects durable systems while making reasonable tradeoffs

jobs.title: Permit Coordinator (Contract)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 Our Mission

At Pulley, we are on a mission to help construction teams break ground faster. The United States is short between 4-7 million homes while housing production and affordability remain near historic lows. Meanwhile, retail and office real estate are still adapting to the post-pandemic world and the AI boom has led to significant investments in data center infrastructure.

Permitting requirements vary vastly by jurisdiction, making it challenging to navigate for home builders, retailers, architects and contractors. It creates a critical bottleneck that every project must traverse. While the industry remains largely fragmented and underserved, we believe that combining cutting-edge software with permitting expertise can condense permitting timelines from months to days or even hours!

🏗️ About Us

We are a passionate team building software for the built environment around us. Founded by Charlie Jacobson and Andreas Rotenberg in 2021, our team combines deep experience in real estate and construction with a track record of shipping software loved by millions of customers.

We’re backed by CRV, Susa Ventures, BoxGroup, Fifth Wall, Operator, South Park Commons, Suffolk Construction and leaders from Plaid, Segment, Procore, ServiceTitan, Built, BuildZoom, and eero.

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

🧑‍💻 The Role

As a Permit Coordinator at Pulley, you’ll help drive permitting forward by handling research, submittals, and coordination with AHJs. This is a part-time role focused on keeping projects moving through clear communication and accurate execution.

📋 Key Responsibilities

  • Own permit execution across jurisdictions — from research to submittal to final approval.

  • Conduct AHJ research, including phone/email outreach, to confirm accurate requirements.

  • Complete applications, upload forms, and manage re-submissions using tools like Pulley, Linear, and Notion.

  • Track status, follow up with city staff, and resolve issues to keep projects on schedule.

👋 Who You Are

  • Detail-oriented and reliable, with strong written and verbal communication skills.

  • Comfortable navigating government websites, permit portals, and online tools.

  • Proactive and resourceful — you don’t wait for next steps, you drive them.

  • Available at least 20 hours/week during business hours

jobs.title: Associate Project Manager, Permitting
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 Our Mission

At Pulley, we are on a mission to help construction teams break ground faster. The United States is short between 4-7 million homes while housing production and affordability remain near historic lows. Meanwhile, retail and office real estate are still adapting to the post-pandemic world and the AI boom has led to significant investments in data center infrastructure.

Permitting requirements vary vastly by jurisdiction, making it challenging to navigate for home builders, retailers, architects and contractors. It creates a critical bottleneck that every project must traverse. While the industry remains largely fragmented and underserved, we believe that combining cutting-edge software with permitting expertise can condense permitting timelines from months to days or even hours!

🏗️ About Us

We are a passionate team building software for the built environment around us. Founded by Charlie Jacobson and Andreas Rotenberg in 2021, our team combines deep experience in real estate and construction with a track record of shipping software loved by millions of customers.

We’re backed by CRV, Susa Ventures, BoxGroup, Fifth Wall, Operator, South Park Commons, Suffolk Construction and leaders from Plaid, Segment, Procore, ServiceTitan, Built, BuildZoom, and eero.

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

🧑‍💻 The Role

Our in-house permitting team is a key function for driving fast, reliable permitting outcomes for our customers. In this role, you will:

  • Support our lead project managers in delivering great permitting outcomes for customers

  • Help conduct permit research with a high degree of accuracy

  • Assist in preparing permit plans

  • Collaborate with city staff on nuances and ambiguities

  • Monitor permit status and ensure timely responses

  • Provide feedback to product & engineering teams to help refine our software platform

  • Work with permitting leadership to refine our standard operating procedures

👋 Who You Are

To be successful in this role, you are likely someone with:

  • 3+ years in either construction management or architecture, with a focus on project management

  • Experience applying for and obtaining construction permits

  • Ability to research permit requirements with accuracy

  • Comfortable interfacing city staff and navigating administrative processes

  • Clear communicator with a strong attention to detail

  • Proactive problem solver

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!


🧑‍💻 THE ROLE

Our in-house permitting team is a key function for driving fast, reliable permitting outcomes for our customers. In this role, you will:

 - Support our lead project managers in delivering great permitting outcomes for customers

 - Help conduct permit research with a high degree of accuracy

 - Assist in preparing permit plans

 - Collaborate with city staff on nuances and ambiguities

 - Monitor permit status and ensure timely responses

 - Provide feedback to product & engineering teams to help refine our software platform

 - Work with permitting leadership to refine our standard operating procedures


👋 WHO YOU ARE

To be successful in this role, you are likely someone with:

 - 3+ years in either construction management or architecture, with a focus on project management

 - Experience applying for and obtaining construction permits

 - Ability to research permit requirements with accuracy

 - Comfortable interfacing city staff and navigating administrative processes

 - Clear communicator with a strong attention to detail

 - Proactive problem solver

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 Our Mission

At Pulley, we are on a mission to help construction teams break ground faster. The United States is short between 4-7 million homes while housing production and affordability remain near historic lows. Meanwhile, retail and office real estate are still adapting to the post-pandemic world and the AI boom has led to significant investments in data center infrastructure.

Permitting requirements vary vastly by jurisdiction, making it challenging to navigate for home builders, retailers, architects and contractors. It creates a critical bottleneck that every project must traverse. While the industry remains largely fragmented and underserved, we believe that combining cutting-edge software with permitting expertise can condense permitting timelines from months to days or even hours!

🏗️ About Us

We are a passionate team building software for the built environment around us. Founded by Charlie Jacobson and Andreas Rotenberg in 2021, our team combines deep experience in real estate and construction with a track record of shipping software loved by millions of customers.

We’re backed by CRV, Susa Ventures, BoxGroup, Fifth Wall, Operator, South Park Commons, Suffolk Construction and leaders from Plaid, Segment, Procore, ServiceTitan, Built, BuildZoom, and eero.

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

🧑‍💻 The Role

As an early engineer at Pulley, you will get to:

  • Help construction teams break ground faster

  • Talk to users, define requirements, and own features end-to-end

  • Shape the team culture, product direction and help build the team

  • Work with a modern tech stack (React, Tailwind, TypeScript, Vercel, and Google Cloud) and help scale our platform to managing nationwide construction portfolios for some of the industry's biggest players.

  • Leverage and develop cutting-edge AI tools to turn unstructured permitting documents and city regulations into delightful experiences.

👋 Who You Are

We are looking for someone who:

  • Thrives in ambiguity and define the right problems to solve

  • Can translate complex customer needs into extensible, scalable product solutions

  • Enjoys collaborating with designers to meticulously craft great experiences

  • Architects durable systems while making reasonable tradeoffs

  • Willing to learn and apply the latest technologies to automate processes

  • Is based in the San Francisco Bay Area, willing to work in person 4 days a week.

  • Has 5+ years of experience working as a full-time software engineer

jobs.title: Project Manager, Permitting [Florida]
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 Our Mission

At Pulley, we are on a mission to help construction teams break ground faster. The United States is short between 4-7 million homes while housing production and affordability remain near historic lows. Meanwhile, retail and office real estate are still adapting to the post-pandemic world and the AI boom has led to significant investments in data center infrastructure.

Permitting requirements vary vastly by jurisdiction, making it challenging to navigate for home builders, retailers, architects and contractors. It creates a critical bottleneck that every project must traverse. While the industry remains largely fragmented and underserved, we believe that combining cutting-edge software with permitting expertise can condense permitting timelines from months to days or even hours!

🏗️ About Us

We are a passionate team building software for the built environment around us. Founded by Charlie Jacobson and Andreas Rotenberg in 2021, our team combines deep experience in real estate and construction with a track record of shipping software loved by millions of customers.

We’re backed by CRV, Susa Ventures, BoxGroup, Fifth Wall, Operator, South Park Commons, Suffolk Construction and leaders from Plaid, Segment, Procore, ServiceTitan, Built, BuildZoom, and eero.

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

🧑‍💻 The Role

You must be located in Florida to be considered for this role.

Project Managers are essential to success. As a Project Manager, you are the key link between clients and the intricate permitting landscape. Your work ensures that projects progress smoothly, overcoming regulatory hurdles, and collaborating with municipal officials to speed up approvals. Your expertise and proactive problem-solving directly impact project timelines, making you a critical part of our mission to transform construction.

In this role, you’ll play a pivotal part in shaping our permitting operations and work closely with leadership, product, and engineering teams to ensure continuous improvement in how we deliver results. Your contributions will help refine best practices and workflows, pushing the industry forward and enabling our clients to build faster and more effectively.

📋 Key Responsibilities

  • Permitting Expertise: Gain a deep understanding of local permitting rules across various markets, focusing on streamlining complex processes.

  • Advise Clients: Act as a trusted advisor, guiding clients through intricate approval processes to achieve fast and efficient outcomes.

  • Collaborate with Municipalities: Build and maintain strong relationships with municipal staff, working together to accelerate approval times.

  • Manage Projects: Oversee multiple permitting projects simultaneously, ensuring that each hits key milestones and moves swiftly to completion while anticipating and resolving potential permitting roadblocks, ensuring projects stay on track.

  • Collaborate Across Teams: Work with internal teams from product, engineering, and leadership to continuously improve Pulley’s platform and enhance the client experience.

🌟 Who You Are

  • Professional Experience: 6+ years in architecture, construction, or permitting, with demonstrated involvement in various permitting processes.

  • Regulatory Knowledge: Strong familiarity with local building codes, zoning regulations, and permitting processes, bonus points for hands on permitting experience in Miami-Dade County.

  • Interpersonal Skills: Excellent communication abilities and talent for building strong relationships with clients and municipal officials.

  • Technical Proficiency: Skilled in using relevant software tools and adaptable in learning new systems that enhance operational efficiency.

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 Our Mission

At Pulley, we are on a mission to help construction teams break ground faster. The United States is short between 4-7 million homes while housing production and affordability remain near historic lows. Meanwhile, retail and office real estate are still adapting to the post-pandemic world and the AI boom has led to significant investments in data center infrastructure.

Permitting requirements vary vastly by jurisdiction, making it challenging to navigate for home builders, retailers, architects and contractors. It creates a critical bottleneck that every project must traverse. While the industry remains largely fragmented and underserved, we believe that combining cutting-edge software with permitting expertise can condense permitting timelines from months to days or even hours!

🏗️ About Us

We are a passionate team building software for the built environment around us. Founded by Charlie Jacobson and Andreas Rotenberg in 2021, our team combines deep experience in real estate and construction with a track record of shipping software loved by millions of customers.

We’re backed by CRV, Susa Ventures, BoxGroup, Fifth Wall, Operator, South Park Commons, Suffolk Construction and leaders from Plaid, Segment, Procore, ServiceTitan, Built, BuildZoom, and eero.

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

This role is based in our San Francisco, CA office, reporting to our CEO, Charlie Jacobson, and collaborating with our collocated design and engineering team of 10+ people.

Who you are

  • You're a product designer who cares deeply about designing the right thing before designing the thing right

  • Driven by curiosity, you find yourself obsessing over problems that "feel weird, but I don't know why yet"

  • Craft is a core value (and one of ours) – ****You have an infectiously high quality bar for how the product shows up, nothing gets past your design QA, and you know how to bring others along the way

  • There is a method to your madness — you use principles and frameworks to solve problems of varying scale, knowing there's no single right approach (but there are wrong ones)

  • Excited about designing for work – at this point everyone uses software to do their jobs, you’re energized by making complex domains simple to work in

  • You are energized by working for startups. Translation: fast paced, async collaboration via Slack, can create something from nothing, act as an owner, and hold strong opinions loosely

What you'll do

  • Design and effectively communicate compelling user flows and specifications for stakeholders and engineers

  • Lead projects from concept to a successful launch, ensuring a high bar of execution

  • Interface directly with customers to collect feedback on new and existing functionality

  • Advocate for the user by partnering with product and engineering on product definition and roadmap

  • Explore leveraging AI to synthesize the complex and diverse world of permitting requirements at scale

  • Contribute to and evolve the design system and product design lifecycle at Pulley

Qualifications

  • 4+ years designing software products; experience designing for enterprise or B2B products or services preferred

  • Expert with Figma designs and prototypes

  • Portfolio demonstrates product and visual design experience with a strong attention to detail

  • Experience contributing to and evangelizing a visual language for highly polished product experiences

  • Successfully shipped web based products and features collaborating closely with engineering

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

🧑‍💻 The Role

We’re hiring our first GTM Engineer to design and build the systems that power our go-to-market engine. This role blends marketing, sales ops, analytics, and engineering. This is a great opportunity for a technical builder who wants to shape how a company scales.

You’ll work at the intersection of AI and our GTM strategy: you’ll have the chance to leverage the latest AI-native tools and automation platforms to improve how our sales and marketing teams find prospects, qualify opportunities, and close deals.

As the first hire in this function, you’ll define how we approach GTM engineering and have broad exposure across the funnel from outbound campaigns to analytics and forecasting. Your work will directly accelerate revenue growth and shape Pulley’s commercial engine.

👋 What You'll Do

  • Build GTM Workflows: Automate outbound prospecting, lead scoring, and follow-ups using tools like Clay, Zapier, APIs, and AI-native platforms.

  • Supercharge Sales: Design pipelines that surface high-intent prospects, accelerate deal velocity, and improve forecasting accuracy.

  • Experiment & Iterate: Rapidly test new growth ideas (campaigns, content workflows, analytics dashboards) and double down on what works.

  • Connect the Stack: Own integrations across CRM, marketing tools, and sales systems to ensure smooth handoffs and accurate data.

  • Insights to Action: Use AI and analytics to uncover market opportunities, build ROI models, and provide decision support to GTM leaders.

  • Scale Learnings: Document workflows, templatize playbooks, and make your systems reusable across the org.

📋 Need to Have

  • 3-6 years of experience in GTM operations, growth, sales/marketing ops, or a technical role at a fast-moving company

  • Technical chops: Comfortable with APIs, webhooks, SQL, and automation platforms (Python/JavaScript a plus)

  • AI-native mindset: You’re scrappy and crafty with tools like Clay, Replit, Notion AI, Zapier, or custom GPT workflows

  • Builder mentality: You’ve hacked together workflows or automated processes to solve problems, not just run campaigns

  • Strong communicator: Can explain technical concepts clearly to sales, marketing, and leadership

  • Analytical: You’re data-driven and comfortable translating metrics into strategy and action

🌟 Nice to Have

  • Experience in early-stage or zero-to-one GTM environments

  • Background in B2B SaaS or in a tech startup with a services oriented business model

  • Exposure to demand gen or growth marketing, but not pigeonholed into one channel

  • Certifications (Clay, Reforge, etc.) or side projects that show off your builder/automation mindset

  • A little humor — we’re serious about building, but we like to have fun!

jobs.title: Founding Account Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 Our Mission

At Pulley, we are on a mission to help construction teams break ground faster. The United States is short between 4-7 million homes while housing production and affordability remain near historic lows. Meanwhile, retail and office real estate are still adapting to the post-pandemic world and the AI boom has led to significant investments in data center infrastructure.

Permitting requirements vary vastly by jurisdiction, making it challenging to navigate for home builders, retailers, architects and contractors. It creates a critical bottleneck that every project must traverse. While the industry remains largely fragmented and underserved, we believe that combining cutting-edge software with permitting expertise can condense permitting timelines from months to days or even hours!

🏗️ About Us

We are a passionate team building software for the built environment around us. Founded by Charlie Jacobson and Andreas Rotenberg in 2021, our team combines deep experience in real estate and construction with a track record of shipping software loved by millions of customers.

We’re backed by CRV, Susa Ventures, BoxGroup, Fifth Wall, Operator, South Park Commons, Suffolk Construction and leaders from Plaid, Segment, Procore, ServiceTitan, Built, BuildZoom, and eero.

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

🧑‍💻 The Role

As Pulley’s first Account Manager, you’ll be in a quota-carrying role focused on driving retention, renewals, and growth within our key accounts. You’ll manage our largest and longest-standing customers, acting as a trusted advisor while ensuring their continued success. This is a high-impact role where you’ll map white space, uncover opportunities, and expand Pulley’s footprint.

  • Own Account Growth & Retention: Manage relationships with Pulley’s largest accounts, driving renewals, cross-sell, and upsell opportunities.

  • Build Account Strategy: Develop and execute structured account plans that align with customer priorities and expand Pulley’s presence.

  • Engage Senior Stakeholders: Deliver clear, tailored pitches that connect Pulley’s value to business needs.

  • Strengthen Customer Partnerships: Proactively monitor account health, adoption, and usage to maximize value and reduce risk.

  • Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Partner with SDRs, product, and support teams to improve customer experience and inform Pulley’s roadmap.

  • Share Insights & Improve: Bring customer feedback to refine messaging, sales processes, and product development.

  • Hit Your Number: Consistently achieve growth targets with strong forecast accuracy.

📋 Need to have

  • 4+ years in account management or quota-carrying sales, with a strong track record in expansion and renewals.

  • Consistent high performance, with proven experience managing complex accounts with multiple stakeholders.

  • Familiarity with sales methodologies (MEDDICC, BANT, Sandler, etc.).

  • Strong pipeline and forecast management skills; CRM proficiency (HubSpot, Salesforce, etc.).

  • Excellent communicator with strong writing, presentation, and interpersonal skills.

  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to balance multiple priorities.

  • Team player with the hustle, curiosity, and flexibility needed to thrive in an early-stage environment.

  • Ability to quickly ramp on new industries and deliver trusted-advisor insights.

🌟 Nice to haves

  • Has worked into construction or construction-adjacent industry

  • Early stage startup experience

  • Eager to work hybrid in Manhattan

jobs.title: Project Manager, Permitting [Los Angeles]
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 Our Mission

At Pulley, we are on a mission to help construction teams break ground faster. The United States is short between 4-7 million homes while housing production and affordability remain near historic lows. Meanwhile, retail and office real estate are still adapting to the post-pandemic world and the AI boom has led to significant investments in data center infrastructure.

Permitting requirements vary vastly by jurisdiction, making it challenging to navigate for home builders, retailers, architects and contractors. It creates a critical bottleneck that every project must traverse. While the industry remains largely fragmented and underserved, we believe that combining cutting-edge software with permitting expertise can condense permitting timelines from months to days or even hours!

🏗️ About Us

We are a passionate team building software for the built environment around us. Founded by Charlie Jacobson and Andreas Rotenberg in 2021, our team combines deep experience in real estate and construction with a track record of shipping software loved by millions of customers.

We’re backed by CRV, Susa Ventures, BoxGroup, Fifth Wall, Operator, South Park Commons, Suffolk Construction and leaders from Plaid, Segment, Procore, ServiceTitan, Built, BuildZoom, and eero.

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

🧑‍💻 The Role

You must be located in Los Angeles to be considered for this role.

Project Managers are essential to success. As a Project Manager, you are the key link between clients and the intricate permitting landscape. Your work ensures that projects progress smoothly, overcoming regulatory hurdles, and collaborating with municipal officials to speed up approvals. Your expertise and proactive problem-solving directly impact project timelines, making you a critical part of our mission to transform construction.

In this role, you’ll play a pivotal part in shaping our permitting operations and work closely with leadership, product, and engineering teams to ensure continuous improvement in how we deliver results. Your contributions will help refine best practices and workflows, pushing the industry forward and enabling our clients to build faster and more effectively.

📋 Key Responsibilities

  • Permitting Expertise: Gain a deep understanding of local permitting rules across various markets, focusing on streamlining complex processes.

  • Advise Clients: Act as a trusted advisor, guiding clients through intricate approval processes to achieve fast and efficient outcomes.

  • Collaborate with Municipalities: Build and maintain strong relationships with municipal staff, working together to accelerate approval times.

  • Manage Projects: Oversee multiple permitting projects simultaneously, ensuring that each hits key milestones and moves swiftly to completion while anticipating and resolving potential permitting roadblocks, ensuring projects stay on track.

  • Collaborate Across Teams: Work with internal teams from product, engineering, and leadership to continuously improve Pulley’s platform and enhance the client experience.

🌟 Who You Are

  • Professional Experience: 6+ years in architecture, construction, or permitting, with demonstrated involvement in various permitting processes.

  • Regulatory Knowledge: Strong familiarity with local building codes, zoning regulations, and permitting processes, specifically in the Los Angeles area.

  • Interpersonal Skills: Excellent communication abilities and talent for building strong relationships with clients and municipal officials.

  • Technical Proficiency: Skilled in using relevant software tools and adaptable in learning new systems that enhance operational efficiency.

jobs.title: Strategy & Operations Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 Our Mission

At Pulley, we are on a mission to help construction teams break ground faster. The United States is short between 4-7 million homes while housing production and affordability remain near historic lows. Meanwhile, retail and office real estate are still adapting to the post-pandemic world and the AI boom has led to significant investments in data center infrastructure.

Permitting requirements vary vastly by jurisdiction, making it challenging to navigate for home builders, retailers, architects and contractors. It creates a critical bottleneck that every project must traverse. While the industry remains largely fragmented and underserved, we believe that combining cutting-edge software with permitting expertise can condense permitting timelines from months to days or even hours!

🏗️ About Us

We are a passionate team building software for the built environment around us. Founded by Charlie Jacobson and Andreas Rotenberg in 2021, our team combines deep experience in real estate and construction with a track record of shipping software loved by millions of customers.

We’re backed by CRV, Susa Ventures, BoxGroup, Fifth Wall, Operator, South Park Commons, Suffolk Construction and leaders from Plaid, Segment, Procore, ServiceTitan, Built, BuildZoom, and eero.

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

🧑‍💻 The Role

We’re looking to add a detail-oriented member to our Business Operations team! In this role, you’ll support our finance and revenue operations, and work cross-functionally across the company. You’ll not only own the essential workflows that power our day-to-day business such as managing our invoice process and powering CRM hygiene with AI tooling, but you’ll also be responsible for new initiatives across pricing, revenue operations, GTM strategy, core finance, data, and company reporting. Your work will be hands-on and high-impact, helping our team stay fast, clear, and accountable.

This is a great role for someone early in their career who loves process and structure but isn’t afraid of ambiguity. This role is based onsite in our NYC office.

👋 Who You Are

  • You take pride in clean processes, tidy systems, and reliable execution

  • You’re curious about how early-stage businesses run and are eager to support behind-the-scenes workflows

  • You enjoy working across teams and solving operational problems

  • You’re organized, comfortable switching between tools, and enjoy keeping things buttoned-up

  • You’re happy to jump into whatever’s needed — no task is too small

  • You bring creativity, are comfortable with ambiguity, and are nimble day in and day out

📋 Need to Have

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent

  • 1–3 years of experience in a business operations, finance, revenue, or operations adjacent role in a startup or fast-paced environment (ie consulting, tech, or finance)

  • At least 1 year of professional experience building complex spreadsheets (e.g., Google Sheets or Excel)

  • At least 1 year of professional experience working with data tools such as SQL

  • At least 1 year of professional experience building internal dashboards and visualizing complex datasets with tools such as Tableau, Mode, or Looker

  • Based in or willing to relocate to New York City (relocation support not provided)

🌟 Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with CRMs like Hubspot and payment systems like Stripe or Ramp

  • Exposure to finance-adjacent workflows (e.g., billing, invoicing, pricing)

  • Experience using AI tools and related technologies to build automation workflows

 - Based in or willing to relocate to New York City (relocation support not provided)


🌟 NICE TO HAVE

 - Familiarity with CRMs like Hubspot and payment systems like Stripe or Ramp

 - Exposure to finance-adjacent workflows (e.g., billing, invoicing, pricing)

 - Experience using AI tools and related technologies to build automation workflows

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 Our Mission

At Pulley, we are on a mission to help construction teams break ground faster. The United States is short between 4-7 million homes while housing production and affordability remain near historic lows. Meanwhile, retail and office real estate are still adapting to the post-pandemic world and the AI boom has led to significant investments in data center infrastructure.

Permitting requirements vary vastly by jurisdiction, making it challenging to navigate for home builders, retailers, architects and contractors. It creates a critical bottleneck that every project must traverse. While the industry remains largely fragmented and underserved, we believe that combining cutting-edge software with permitting expertise can condense permitting timelines from months to days or even hours!

🏗️ About Us

We are a passionate team building software for the built environment around us. Founded by Charlie Jacobson and Andreas Rotenberg in 2021, our team combines deep experience in real estate and construction with a track record of shipping software loved by millions of customers.

We’re backed by CRV, Susa Ventures, BoxGroup, Fifth Wall, Operator, South Park Commons, Suffolk Construction and leaders from Plaid, Segment, Procore, ServiceTitan, Built, BuildZoom, and eero.

🏠 What We’re Building

We’re building the world’s first software platform for construction permitting — for any project, in any city. Our north star is speed; everything we do is in the service of helping our customers get their permits as fast as possible.

We serve some of the top developers, builders, retailers and architects in the industry to permit new apartment buildings, office space, homes, stores and much more!

🧑‍💻 The Role

We are hiring software engineers to join the Pulley team and help us accelerate our product development. As an early engineer at Pulley, you will get to:

  • Help construction teams break ground faster

  • Leverage and develop cutting-edge AI tools to turn unstructured and highly varied permitting processes, documents and city regulations into delightful experiences.

  • Talk to users, define requirements, and own features end-to-end

  • Learn from a seasoned engineering team with a diverse set of experiences

  • Work with a modern tech stack (React, Tailwind, TypeScript and Vercel) and help scale our platform to managing nationwide construction portfolios for some of the industry's biggest players.

We are looking for someone who:

  • Has 2-5 years of experience

  • Is based in or willing to relocate to the San Francisco Bay Area

  • Willing to work in-person 4 days a week.

  • Thrives in ambiguity and defines the right problems to solve

  • Can translate complex customer needs into extensible, scalable product solutions

  • Enjoys collaborating with designers to meticulously craft great experiences

  • Willing to learn and apply the latest technologies to automate processes
